title: How To Print in React Using Iframes

`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:`Let's say you're building an e-commerce website. Users have requested they want the option to print a receipt after their purchase.\r
You don't want to mess with PDFs, so you'd like to use the web to create the structure and styling for you.`}),`
`,(0,e.jsx)(n.p,{children:`After completing their payment, users should have the option to click a "print receipt" button.\r
This only loads the contents of the receipt and invokes the browser print dialog for them.\r
It should be reusable so we can reference the same receipt from their order history.`}),`

`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:[`Why do we need iframes to solve this problem?\r
Our use case requires loading `,(0,e.jsx)(n.em,{children:"only the receipt"})," and nothing else. It should be available in other parts of the application as well."]}),`
`,(0,e.jsxs)(n.p,{children:["We can create an ",(0,e.jsx)(n.code,{children:"iframe"})," which loads the contents of our receipt. Once the content has finished loading, we can invoke the browser print API. This means it will only print what we want and allows us to reuse this component/route in other places."]}),`
